Message.Title: M$ Targets Growing Mobile Workforce With 15% Hike In Corporate User Licensing Fees
Message.Msg: "Microsoft is targeting the growing mobile workforce with a 15 percent hike in license fees directed primarily at companies that have employees who use smartphones and other mobile devices in their work. According to Mary Jo Foley, the new licensing agreement goes into effect December 1 for customers with the user option for its “client access licenses” (CAL). "

Topic.Title: HFT/Super computers just took the retail guys to the woods

Message.Msg: They can't take shares that aren't for sale. Sure, thay can borrow your shares from your broker and sell, but you still own the shares. Stay off margin and don't sell simply because the price goes down.

Message.Title: Cowhen upgraded GOOG to outperform
Message.Msg: After hour..read mews under yahoo.

Cyber...what's up? Something peculiar is going on here. Yesterday, the CEO sells 50k shares at 6.62/share. Now, he's been called for a wrap-up hearing on the anti-trust thing. Hmmm...so why the pump up today? Normally, when a CEO sells 50k shares, the stock tanks--at least a little--since the CEO just might know something we don't. Instead, GOOG goes up $9+. Setup?
Oops...make that 662/share.
link would've been good; took a few mins. to find. folks: its actually in "After-Hours Buzz" article from CNBC.
if you read in more detail, the sale of shares was a scheduled sale.
my initial take is that we're done selling; it was overdone (panic selling) imo. we've washed out the sellers; next leg up.
explains today's strength
